gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 7,11]]Jesus journeyed to a city called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd accompanied him.
[[Lc 7,12]]As he drew near to the gate of the city, a man who had died was being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. A large crowd from the city was with her.
[[Lc 7,13]]When the Lord saw her, he was moved with pity for her and said to her, "Do not weep."
[[Lc 7,14]]He stepped forward and touched the coffin; at this the bearers halted, and he said, "Young man, I tell you, arise!"
[[Lc 7,15]]The dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him to his mother.
[[Lc 7,16]]Fear seized them all, and they glorified God, exclaiming, "A great prophet has arisen in our midst," and "God has visited his people."
[[Lc 7,17]]This report about him spread through the whole of Judea and in all the surrounding region.

psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.title: First Letter to the Corinthians
first_reading.text:
[[1_Co 12,12]]Brothers and sisters: As a body is one though it has many parts, and all the parts of the body, though many, are one body, so also Christ.
[[1_Co 12,13]]For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, slaves or free persons, and we were all given to drink of one Spirit.
[[1_Co 12,14]]Now the body is not a single part, but many.
[[1_Co 12,27]]Now you are Christ's body, and individually parts of it.
[[1_Co 12,28]]Some people God has designated in the church to be, first, apostles; second, prophets; third, teachers; then, mighty deeds; then, gifts of healing, assistance, administration, and varieties of tongues.
[[1_Co 12,29]]Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Do all work mighty deeds?
[[1_Co 12,30]]Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak in tongues? Do all interpret?
[[1_Co 12,31a]]Strive eagerly for the greatest spiritual gifts.
